Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2008 09:24AM Springmom wrote: Good Day to All.  I have had 4 chemo treatments (cocktail) then a double lumpectomy; eight nodes removed with 1 testing positive; then 4 more chemo (taxotere) treatments and have just begun 7 weeks of rads.  So far all is ok.  I am prone to fatigue to expect to experience that side effect; I have learned not to fight that and just go with it.  Afternoon naps have become a part of my routine throughout this BC journey.  It is great to find a place to share experiences with others who are going through the same.  About the bra, I really have not been able to wear my usual bra since my surgery and have become comfortable in a camisole or sports bra.  There are sports bras with varying levels of support for those who need.  Most importantly just take care of yourself; eat well and nap when ya can.  And find someone to talk to.  A friend of mine is taking me to treatments every day;  She is committed to every morning for the next 7 weeks.  My hubby will be there today for the Dr. visit.  Anyway, Good luck to all of you.
Posts.Title: Looking for a February Rad Team debbbyb twirlgirl
